item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS 15.2 breaks the ability to copy the OS to another drive (15 points | discuss)
2. Luon programming language combines concepts from Oberon and Lua (46 points | 8 comments)
3. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (136 points | 21 comments)
4. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (5 points | discuss)
5. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (139 points | 38 comments)
6. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (115 points | 17 comments)
7. Pompeii experts back Pliny's account of Mount Vesuvius eruption date (24 points | 6 comments)
8. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (84 points | 31 comments)
9. Making my first robot as a software engineer (198 points | 24 comments)
10. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (145 points | 25 comments)
11. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (161 points | 40 comments)
12. Schrödinger's IPv6 Cat (31 points | 31 comments)
13. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (144 points | 97 comments)
14. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (147 points | 16 comments)
15. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (86 points | 30 comments)
16. McKinsey and Company to pay $650M for role in opioid crisis (47 points | 9 comments)
17. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (356 points | 377 comments)
18. Donald Bitzer has died (148 points | 17 comments)
19. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (203 points | 55 comments)
20. SCCS roach motel (36 points | 11 comments)
21. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
22. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (49 points | 21 comments)
23. Show HN: Performant intracontinental public transport routing in Rust (3 points | discuss)
24. Test (434 points | 97 comments)
25. 0x01 – Killing Windows Kernel Mitigations (73 points | 5 comments)
26. Bit-permuting 16 u32s at once with AVX-512 (33 points | discuss)
27. NASA believes it understands why Ingenuity crashed on Mars (51 points | 32 comments)
28. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (370 points | 186 comments)
29. Enigmatic Writing from the Republic of Georgia (4 points | discuss)
30. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (66 points | 20 comments)
